intro: Pelargonium collae, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sunlight. It has hairy leaves and produces small, rounded fruits that contain numerous seeds. Pelargonium collae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
